title: Multi-Domain Optical Network Collaborative Fault Management: Self-Directed and Federated Learning Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Basic principles of optical networking, foundational machine learning, and practical experience in network management
context.additional_context: A course designed for practitioners to acquire data-driven fault management competencies in multi-domain optical network environments, with theory-practice parallel learning via LMS

learning_goals: They can design a self-supervised learning model that identifies normal/abnormal patterns by analyzing optical network performance monitoring data
They can implement a cross-domain collaborative fault detection model using a federated learning framework while complying with privacy constraints
By applying uncertainty estimation techniques, they can achieve over 95% fault detection accuracy even in environments with insufficient anomaly data
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
